page.title: 09 FARMING
page.content: In the four most northerly squares there are{seven farms.}This area has been farmland for{many years.}One farm has a date stone inscribed 1799 built into a wall and has been owned by the same family for three generations. Some of the fields are cultivated grassland but the farmer also grows a variety of vegetables and people pay to graze horses too. Sometimes a farrier comes on a Saturday to shoe horses. Other farms also graze horses, sheep and cattle, and have some cultivated grassland. One farm with an old black and white timbered farmhouse called The Old Hall, has 28 calves, 6 goats, 40 sheep, 36 hens and 15 pigs. Another farm is a dairy farm, and has l7,000 hens and 9 beef cattle. The farmer runs a milk delivery service and also sells milk and eggs to shops.
